parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To groan together. From sun and stenazo; to moan jointly, i.e. experience a common calamity.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be in travail together. From sun and odino; to have pangs in company with, i.e. to sympathize.
As far as, up to, until, during. Or achris akh'-rece; akin to akron; until or up to.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
